instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437B: What is 820-3437B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging
threads.message:
Hi Team,
I've this board that is not charging , no sign of WD, and already swapped battery

With the battery connected and the board ON :
ppbus: 8.37V
activity on SCL and SDA lines
pin 4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> is mesuring 0.969V then pulsing to 8.35V in cycle.....which doesn't allow the battery to charge.
Also when the mba is OFF the board is not pulling power: 0.008A and at Pin4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> it clycling between 0V to 7V in loop and clycles also at pin 5 from 0V to 5V
Already replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U5601</CHIP>: without succes
I'm suspecting <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> or upstream, have to find the reason of that interruption on pin 4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging
threads.message:
OSX reports battery percentage?
Does it start on battery alone?
Use another battery, with some charge, for this test; if original is drained.

Post <SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON with board on/off and battery present and not.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging
threads.message:
Yes OSX reports percentage
Yes it's starting with the battery alone
I'm using a battery charged at 70%

Board OFF with Battery Only:
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL>: 0.00V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL>: 0.049V

Board ON with Battery Only:
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL>: 0.00V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL>: 0.100V

Board OFF with Battery and Charger:
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL>: 0.660V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL>: 0.00V

Board ON with Battery and Charger:
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL>: 0.880V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL>: 0.49V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL>: 0.49V"
Looks like battery is charging.
At least this signal shows battery receives current from MLB.
Unless you have a problem with <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>-52, or traces to pins 17/18 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging
threads.message:
I checked the resistance R17/18 and it's ok: around 3 Ohms.
I've seen like a short between pin 15 and 16 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and reflowed as shown in the attached pictures, I've also resoldered J6950, but it didn't solved the issue.

[ATTACH alt="Click image for larger version  Name:	20190922-132545-860.jpg Views:	0 Size:	71.3 KB ID:	52484" type="full" width="30%"]52486._xfImport[/ATTACH][ATTACH alt="Click image for larger version  Name:	Full Logo.jpg Views:	0 Size:	11.5 KB ID:	52487" type="full" width="30%"]52487._xfImport[/ATTACH]

I've noticed that with the battery completly empty I'm reading 8.55V for <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>, usually when the battery is not full it should mesure under ppbus (8.55V) , like between 7V to 8.55V no?
It's acting like the battery is full no?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging
threads.message:
Hi,
Just to let you know that the problem is fixed.
Now with the board ON it's pulling almost 3 Amps, <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> stays low and pulsing like before.
I can see the percentage rising quite fast.
I fact, I think that in all the things I did, one of them solved the issue except that the battery was continiouly showing 1%. This one is dead.
So I replaced it with another one now it's charging normally.

Again thanks for your support and patience

You can set this Topic as Solved. but i you could just answser to the question regarding the battery logos......thanks

Best Regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not charging
threads.message:
Left side logo shows battery is charging.
Right side not charging, probably "Replace now" advice in drop down list menu for battery...
